Following the success of ‘RRR’, Rajamouli’s ambitious collaboration promises a major cinematic spectacle.

description: Jan Suraaj supremo Prashant Kishor accepted full responsibility for his party's complete failure in the 2025 Bihar Assembly elections, admitting he could not earn voters' trust. Despite contesting 238 seats, Jan Suraaj won none, with Kishor vowing to intensify his work in Bihar and observe a silent fast as atonement.

title: Ind vs SA: Who did what in first training session post India's 1st Test loss?
description: Indian batters Sai Sudharsan and Dhruv Jurel experimented with batting without a front pad during optional practice, a technique aimed at improving front-foot play against spin. This traditional drill encourages batters to rely on their bat for defense, addressing a tendency to play on the back foot. The move comes as Shubman Gill's participation in the upcoming Test remains uncertain.

This pursuit of quick profits has become a national obsession, rewarding randomness over reasoned analysis.

description: After their triumphant performance at the Asian Championship, India's archery team found themselves in dire straits in Dhaka. A sudden flight cancellation, fueled by escalating unrest in the city, left them stranded in an inadequate shelter for the night, void of security. The turmoil resulted in missed flights and unexpected expenses, casting a shadow over their exceptional victory.

All you need to know about: pneumonia
description: Pneumonia is an infection of the lungs that can be caused by bacteria, viruses or fungi. The infection causes an inflammation in the air sacs of the lungs and the accumulation of fluid or pus in the lungs

title: 'He'll break my head or my toe': KL Rahul makes shocking Bumrah admission
description: KL Rahul humorously expressed concern about facing Jasprit Bumrah in nets after learning of his strong IPL record against the pacer. Rahul highlighted Bumrah's intensity and difficulty to score against, even for familiar teammates. He revealed his strategy of reminding Bumrah they are on the same team to calm him during practice.

title: Ambulance carrying family catches fire near Modasa town; 4, including infant, killed, 3 injured
description: Tragedy struck near Modasa as an ambulance carrying a family and an infant to Ahmedabad caught fire, claiming four lives, including the baby. The vehicle, dispatched by a private hospital, erupted in flames around midnight. A doctor and nurse were also among the deceased. Three individuals sustained burn injuries and are receiving medical attention.

Chinese authorities are prioritizing increased marriage and birth rates to counter an aging population.

Investigators believe the video was meant to radicalize others.

Karnataka wildlife crisis: 31 of 38 blackbucks dead in Belagavi zoo
description: Karnataka's zoos are enhancing vigilance after 31 blackbucks died, suspected to be from haemorrhagic septicaemia.  Authorities have directed zoos to strengthen biosecurity, isolate affected animals, and implement immediate carcass disposal and quarantine measures to prevent further outbreaks.

title: 'I will sort it out': Lalu Yadav tells RJD MLAs fallout with Rohini ‘family issue’
description: RJD chief Lalu Prasad urged party workers to focus on strengthening the organization, stating that the "family matter will be solved inside the house." This comes after his daughter Rohini Acharya publicly blamed Tejashwi Yadav's aides for the party's election defeat and alleged mistreatment.

title: Saudi bus accident: 3 generations wiped out as 18 from one family killed
description: A family's joy turned to tragedy when 18 members of the Shaik family perished in a bus fire in Saudi Arabia while en route to Medina. The family, who lived in a bustling home in Hyderabad's Vidyanagar, were on a pilgrimage. Only one immediate family member, living in the US, survives this devastating loss.

title: SC: Tetra packs of whisky dangerous, why allow them?
description: The Supreme Court expressed concern over states permitting liquor sales in small tetra packs, likening them to juice containers and highlighting potential risks to children. This issue emerged during a trademark dispute between whisky producers Allied Blenders and John Distillers, where tetra packs constitute a significant portion of sales in some regions.

title: Gujarat horror: Man strangles wife for ‘jobless’ jibe; arrested
description: A man in Vadodara allegedly strangled his wife late Sunday night. The couple frequently argued about his unemployment. During a heated argument, the wife reportedly taunted him about his joblessness. The man then lost his temper and attacked her. Police have registered a murder complaint and arrested the accused.

title: Woman drugged, gang-raped by 4; then raped again by 2 UP cops
description: Two sub-inspectors in Bulandshahr face suspension following a survivor's grave allegations of rape and extortion. The 28-year-old woman claims the officers sexually assaulted her for two days and demanded Rs 50,000, purportedly for action against her initial gang-rape assaulters. An inquiry is underway into the serious accusations.

title: Indian student sentenced to 97 months in prison in Texas; here is why
description: An Indian student, Dhruv Rajeshbhai Mangukiya, received a 97-month prison sentence and ordered to pay over $2.5 million in restitution for a money laundering conspiracy. He and his co-conspirator targeted elderly individuals, tricking them into sending cash and gold to resolve fabricated investigations. Mangukiya also admitted to recruiting his co-conspirator and using a printer for fake IDs.
